intro: Critoniopsis pichinchensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of Ecuador. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
